messages: 026f3459df34a7d1f6b4b610a5db7307 (15:48): will this make vim to always write spaces in the file: http://paste.husk.org/6288 ?
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (15:51): but if the file had tabs in it, and you do not explicitly convert them to spaces, vim will write them out as tabs
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (15:51): to convert them into spaces use the :retab command
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (15:51): by the way you might want to look into the 'softtabstop' option
19086dec2f8c381d0b68baaee12bef92 (16:01): but I also set softtabstop to 4

add4f3a531f25e2f826dc5d53fa1ee70 (16:07): what's the difference in definition of 'word' and 'WORD'? i.e. difference between moving with w and W. from the manual: http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/motion.html#word-motions
19086dec2f8c381d0b68baaee12bef92 (16:08): I have somethign just for that

19086dec2f8c381d0b68baaee12bef92 (16:20): mauke: I wish vim had better rtl support
